attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Mega Venusaur ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solar Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may use this Ability. Move a Basic Grass Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jungle Dump
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stomping Wood
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jam-Packed
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Grass Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pumped-Up Whip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 140 more damage.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Wild Growth
abilities.text: Each Basic Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon provides GrassGrass Energy. The effect of Wild Growth doesn't stack.

abilities.name: Fermented Juice
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached, you may use this Ability. Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Traverse Time
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Grass Pokémon and Stadium cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reversing Gust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Earthen Power
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 50 more damage.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Explosiveness
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down in the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Turbo Flare
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mega Camerupt ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 160 more damage.

attacks.name: Volcanic Meteor
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jumping Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Cast-Off Shell
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Search your deck for a Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supernatural Shapeshifter
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck, and if that card is a Supporter card, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Coiling Crush
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Riptide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Basic Water Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Swirling Waves
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Earth
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium in play, discard it. If you do, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mega Abomasnow ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hammer-lanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck, and this attack does 100 damage for each Basic Water Energy card that you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Fall Back to Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from the Active Spot to your Bench, you may use this Ability. Attach up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Launcher
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bring Down
attacks.text: Choose a Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) that has the least HP remaining, except for this Pokémon, and it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Water Shot
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Chilling Wings
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Upper Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Magneton during this turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Flashing Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Flashing Bolt.

attacks.name: Electro Fall
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Lightning Energy in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Mega Manectric ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flash Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Riotous Blasting
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon and have this attack do 130 more damage.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Psychic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Electrified Incisors
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they attach an Energy card from their hand to the Defending Pokémon, place 8 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Teleportation Attack
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Psychic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Powerful Hand
attacks.text: Place 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon for each card in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mega Gardevoir ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overflowing Wishes
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mega Symphonia
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fragile Husk
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon ex, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

attacks.name: Damage Beat
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Energized Steps
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Geo Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Psychic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bright Horns
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Bright Horns.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Horrifying Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pow-Pow Punching
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Heave-Ho Catcher
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Wild Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Lunar Cycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have Solrock in play, you may discard a Basic Fighting Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Lunar Cycle Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab.

attacks.name: Shadowy Side Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Lucario ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Jab
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mega Brave
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Mega Brave.

attacks.name: Cosmic Beam
attacks.text: If you don't have Lunatone on your Bench, this attack does nothing. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Stony Kick
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use attacks.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Powerful a-Salt
abilities.text: Attacks used by your Fighting Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cutting Riposte
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack can be used for Darkness.

data.name: Mega Absol ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Terminal Period
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has exactly 6 damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Claw of Darkness
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you discard a card you find there.

abilities.name: Spiteful Swirl
abilities.text: If your Active Darkness Pokémon is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if your Active Darkness Pokémon is Knocked Out), place 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mountain Breaker
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Greedy Hunt
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Miraculous Paint
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Welcoming Tail
attacks.text: If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 200 more damage.

data.name: Mega Mawile ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gobble Down
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Huge Bite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 30.

attacks.name: Chrono Burst
attacks.text: You may shuffle all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your deck and have this attack do 80 more damage.

abilities.name: Haphazard Hammer
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Windup Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 60 less damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: All-You-Can-Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of heads and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mega Latias ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Illusory Impulse
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Lustrous Assist
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when your Mega Latias ex moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may use this Ability. Move any amount of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Repeating Drill
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Mega Kangaskhan ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Run Errand
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may use this Ability. Draw 2 cards. You can't use more than 1 Run Errand Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fire Combo
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Quick Gift
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bellyful of Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dashing Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

abilities.name: Evidence Gathering
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Switch a card from your hand with the top card of your deck.

attacks.name: Hyper Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Acerola's Mischief
rules: You can use this card only if your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.  Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to that Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon ex.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a Basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Fighting Gong
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Fighting Energy card or a Basic Fighting Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Forest of Vitality
rules: Each player's Grass Pokémon can evolve into Grass Pokémon during the turn they play those Pokémon, except during their first turn.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Iron Defender
rules: During your opponent's next turn, all of your Metal Pokémon take 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (This includes new Pokémon that come into play.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Lillie's Determination
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards. If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lt. Surge's Bargain
rules: Ask your opponent if each player may take a Prize card. If yes, each player takes a Prize card. If no, you draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mega Signal
rules: Search your deck for a Mega Evolution Pokémon ex, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Mystery Garden
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard an Energy card from their hand in order to draw cards until they have as many cards in their hand as they have Psychic Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Premium Power Pro
rules: During this turn, attacks used by your Fighting Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Repel
rules: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Risky Ruins
rules: Whenever any player puts a Basic non-Darkness Pokémon onto their Bench during their turn, place 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Strange Timepiece
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Psychic Pokémon by putting any number of Evolution cards on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Surfing Beach
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may switch their Active Water Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Water Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.  Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Wally's Compassion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex. If you healed any damage in this way, put all Energy attached to that Pokémon into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Air Balloon
rules: The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

data.name: Buddy-Buddy Poffin
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon with 70 HP or less and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Mega Latias ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Illusory Impulse
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Kangaskhan ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Run Errand
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may use this Ability. Draw 2 cards. You can't use more than 1 Run Errand Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fire Combo
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Fighting Gong
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Fighting Energy card or a Basic Fighting Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Lillie's Determination
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards. If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lt. Surge's Bargain
rules: Ask your opponent if each player may take a Prize card. If yes, each player takes a Prize card. If no, you draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mega Signal
rules: Search your deck for a Mega Evolution Pokémon ex, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Mystery Garden
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard an Energy card from their hand in order to draw cards until they have as many cards in their hand as they have Psychic Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

data.name: Night Stretcher
rules: Put a Pokémon or a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Mega Absol ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Terminal Period
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has exactly 6 damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Claw of Darkness
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you discard a card you find there.

data.name: Lillie's Determination
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards. If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mega Gardevoir ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overflowing Wishes
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mega Symphonia
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Latias ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Illusory Impulse
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Wally's Compassion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex. If you healed any damage in this way, put all Energy attached to that Pokémon into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Premium Power Pro
rules: During this turn, attacks used by your Fighting Pokémon do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Wally's Compassion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex. If you healed any damage in this way, put all Energy attached to that Pokémon into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mega Venusaur ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solar Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may use this Ability. Move a Basic Grass Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jungle Dump
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Gardevoir ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overflowing Wishes
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mega Symphonia
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Kangaskhan ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Run Errand
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may use this Ability. Draw 2 cards. You can't use more than 1 Run Errand Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fire Combo
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Mega Lucario ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Jab
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mega Brave
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Mega Brave.

data.name: Acerola's Mischief
rules: You can use this card only if your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.  Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to that Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon ex.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lt. Surge's Bargain
rules: Ask your opponent if each player may take a Prize card. If yes, each player takes a Prize card. If no, you draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mega Lucario ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Jab
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mega Brave
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Mega Brave.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: Its scientific name is Oddium wanderus. It is said to cover distances as far as 1,000 feet when night falls, walking on its two roots.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Disperse Drool
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

data.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Pollen Bomb
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lively Flower
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.

data.name: Mega Heracross ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Juggernaut Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: The leaf on its head is naturally dirt repellent and will stay clean even after transporting Pokémon that are covered in mud.

data.name: Lombre

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It prefers waterfronts with plentiful food. It became nocturnal so it wouldn't have to compete for food with bird Pokémon.

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Excited Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have any Grass Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, you may use this Ability. Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There are structures throughout its whole body that produce energy when hit by sound waves with a cheerful rhythm.

data.name: Genesect

attacks.name: Bug's Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

data.name: Nymble

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Lokix

attacks.name: Jumping Shot
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.flavorText: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.

data.name: Charmander

abilities.name: Agile
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life-force. If Charmander is weak, the flame also burns weakly.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, the temperature around it rises higher and higher, tormenting its opponents.

data.name: Mega Charizard X ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Inferno X
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fire Energy from among your Pokémon, and this attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Fighting Wings
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it's pushed or pulled.

data.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Burning Flare
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

data.name: Oricorio ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Excited Turbo
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, if you have any Fire Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, you may use this Ability. Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Charcadet

attacks.name: Gather Strength
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Ceruledge

attacks.name: Infernal Slash
attacks.text: Discard 4 Basic Fire Energy cards from your hand. If you can't discard 4 cards in this way, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

data.name: Seel

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The protrusion on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

data.name: Dewgong

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Fire or Water Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's colder.

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: It searches for food by digging into the ground with its snout. Even frozen ground doesn't give it any trouble.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is resistant to the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.

data.name: Mamoswine

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium.

attacks.name: Blizzard Edge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.

data.name: Suicune

attacks.name: Crystal Fall
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Water Energy in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Call for Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Targeted Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees in half with a single hit.

data.name: Rotom ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Multi Adapter
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has "Rotom" in its name may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached. If this Ability goes away, discard Pokémon Tools from those Pokémon until only 1 remains on each.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Yamper

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

data.name: Boltund

attacks.name: Electric Run
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

data.name: Pawmi

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

data.name: Pawmo
data.flavorText: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

data.name: Pawmot

attacks.name: Voltaic Fist
attacks.text: You may have this Pokémon also do 60 damage to itself and make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

data.name: Mismagius ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Swirling Prose
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon moves to the Bench during their turn, their new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hexa-Magic
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: In truth, it is a cowardly Pokémon. It growls eagerly in order to hide its fear from its opponent.

data.name: Granbull

attacks.name: Finishing Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it desperately flails its limbs about in an attempt to repel its opponent.

data.name: Cresselia

attacks.name: Swelling Light
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Psychic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

data.name: Meloetta

attacks.name: Soothing Melody
attacks.text: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Benched Psychic Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

data.name: Mega Diancie ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Diamond Coat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Garland Ray
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from this Pokémon, and this attack does 120 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Mimikyu

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

data.name: Milcery

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The more sweet aromas it absorbs, the more its body swells. Milcery will deflate when its energy level drops.

data.name: Alcremie

attacks.name: Sweet Circle
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play.

data.flavorText: Desserts that Alcremie have decorated with their cream have a rich, sweet flavor and bring happiness to all who eat them.

data.name: Zacian

attacks.name: Limit Break
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King's Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.

data.name: Bramblin

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Place 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

data.name: Brambleghast

abilities.name: Prison Panic
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Make your opponent's Active Pokémon Confused.

data.flavorText: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.

data.name: Paldean Tauros

attacks.name: Raging Charge
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your Pokémon that has "Tauros" in its name that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a muscular body and excels at close-quarters combat. It uses its short horns to strike the opponent's weak spots.

data.name: Gligar

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It patiently awaits prey inside its funnel- shaped nest.

data.name: Vibrava
data.flavorText: Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for flight, it rubs them together, emitting ultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.

data.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Sandy Flapping
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. You may also use this Ability if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon. Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: Known as the Desert Spirit, this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

data.name: Mega Gengar ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadowy Concealment
abilities.text: If 1 of your Darkness Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon ex, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card. The effect of Shadowy Concealment doesn't stack.

attacks.name: Void Gale
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

data.name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Sniping Feathers
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Cocky Claw
attacks.text: If you have any Stage 2 Darkness Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

data.name: Carvanha

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

data.name: Mega Sharpedo ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Fang
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Hungry Jaws
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Seviper

abilities.name: Excited Power
abilities.text: If you have any Darkness Mega Evolution Pokémon ex in play, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
